title: NavBar Icon
custom_preconds:
GIVEN new logos and colors are provided by product for a specific team
AND user has installed Ballpark App
AND user is logged out

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user logs in
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is shown the HomePage with Home highlighter on the NavBar
AND the NavBar has the default MLB logo shown greyed out

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on the 'Team' logo on the Bottom NavBar
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN a team-picker is shown with the correct team logo and team name matching the hex value and team logo provided by product/design

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN users taps on a team shown on the team-picker
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the team page is shown for the selected team 
AND the NavBar now shows the selected team's logo with correct team name and color

title: Team Picker on Team Tab
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user is logged in.
GIVEN that the user has a few favorite teams
custom_expected: THEN Selected teams data is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Teams tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the team page is shown, matching the same team shown in Nav Bar
AND a check to the right, indicating it is currently displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the team picker drop down
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display 'My Teams' at the top with the previously favorited teams in the same sequential order, with their team logo to the left

THEN the app will display 'All Team' under the 'My Teams' with the previously favorited teams removed since they are listed under 'My Teams'. 
AND remaining teams are displayed alphabetically by location, with their team logo to the left


in the same sequential order, with their team logo to the right

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on one of the teams (including the already selected team)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the team is selected and the team selector dismisses

title: Navigate Between Park Info  and Schedule
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user selected a favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Team tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be able to have a segment controlled sub tab structure to change between "Park Info" and "Schedule"
AND "Park Info" is set as the default tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates between 'Park Info' and 'Schedule'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the segment control "highlight" will be indicated by team primary color underline

title: Park Info
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed BP
AND the user is logged in 
AND the user navigates to Team tab having selected a team
custom_steps: WHEN the user on the team page
custom_expected:
THEN within Park Info tab, all the references to Team name, logo, and colors are shown correctly
*references = images, links' text, buttons' text/color, webviews, etc

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user navigates to Team tab 
AND the user taps on Park info (if not already applied)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the venue image on the top

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is shown the team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN all the references within the page to Team name, logo, and colors are shown correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on each button/link presented
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is taken to the desired location, where the Team name, logo, and colors are shown correctly

title: Schedule
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user is in the Team tab on Schedule sub tab

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Schedule drop down
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a bottom sheet is presented with 'Home Games' and check to the right indicating that it is the current selection
AND a bottom sheet is presented with 'Home Games' without check to the right

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Full Schedule' option
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bottom sheet prompt is closed 
AND the Full Schedule is displayed and all games returned by the service

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is presented the team schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Team logo and name are show correctly on each upcoming game

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Schedule drop down (Full Schedule)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a bottom sheet is presented with 'Full Schedule' and check to the right indicating that it is the current selection
AND a bottom sheet is presented with 'Home Games' without check to the right

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Home Games' option
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the bottom sheet prompt is closed 
AND the Home Games is displayed and only games where the selected team is set as the home team are displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is presented the team schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Team logo and name are show correctly on each upcoming game

title: Check in button default state
custom_preconds:
As a user, I want to be given the option to Check In to an event when I'm on the Team Tab, so I can add the game to my history and unlock offers.

GIVEN User is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the team tab
custom_expected: THEN the check in button is ALWAYS SHOWN. The color of the text is the primary color of the current team (i.e. if the current team is the Brewers, the button text would be a blue color).

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN Login with MLB account in Ballpark app
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Successfully logged in with MLB account

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN  the user is on the Team Tab,Check IN button should shown and text of the team turn to Blue if it's Brewers
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the check in button is ALWAYS SHOWN. The color of the text is the primary color of the current team (i.e. if the current team is the Brewers, the button text would be a blue color)

title: Check In Details
custom_preconds:
GIVEN The user is logged in and satisfies all conditions needed to allow a Check-in to occur

Note to complete a check-in User must:
* have location permissions (precise) enabled for Ballpark App on the device
* have device located at the venue (can be mocked)
* have a home game scheduled at the team venue within 3 hrs of device time (can be mocked)
custom_expected:
THEN the default check in view is shown
The header will show for game events: the away logo, away name, home name, home team logo, date, time, park location
                     for non-game events: title of event, date, time, location

The user can enter information into the "What's happening at the ballpark?" text field
The user can enter a Section, Row, and Seat

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN location permissions (precise) enabled for Ballpark App on the device
AND user's device is located at the venue
AND a game is available within 3 hours from device time
AND user is on Team Tab (Prod/Staging env)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Team Tab opens with game available to checkin

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user opens a check in modal
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the default check in view is shown
*header will show for game events: the away logo, away name, home name, home team logo, date, time, park location
*header will show for non-game events: title of event, date, time, location

The user can enter information into the "What's happening at the ballpark?" text field
The user can enter a Section, Row, and Seat

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps Done
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the modal shows a loading screen trying to check in.
If successful, then the modal closes and animates the check in button
If failure, then the modal shows the the normal state and the user can try again

title: Venue message and a header image
custom_preconds:
As a fan attending an event who loves My History & Check In offers and is interested in venue only experiences, I want to know when I view the home tab that I’m in the venue

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.5.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user's device has location permissions (precise) enabled for Ballpark App on the device
custom_steps:
WHEN user's device is located at the venue (can be mocked)
AND the user opens the app to Home Page
custom_expected: THEN user sees a welcome to the venue message and a header image for the venue

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user's device is located at team's venue (i.e Arizona's - Chase Field)
AND the user opens the app to Home Page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a welcome to the venue message and a header image particular to venue 

*Header Image and Text are passed into the Firestore doc generated by HomeServices

title: Verified Primary Account for Game Event
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.2.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the Primary email for the account is verified
AND a game event is returned from box office ticketing service upcoming API

As of April 2021, the following acct satisfies -
Verified Account with Game event Tickets
* ENV: QA
* Acct/PW: steve.ortiz@mlb.com / MLBmlb123
* oktaID: 00uwu9xdghKlLB56B0h7
custom_steps: WHEN the user on the home tab
custom_expected: THEN user will see event information

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a game event is returned for future date
AND user navigates to Home tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user will be shown Next Ticketed Event Card

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user examines the Next Ticketed Event Card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN startTime/startTIimeLocalText is displayed as day of the week, date, and local time of event is shown within the Next Ticketed Event(NTE) card

Example: 'Tue, Apr 20 - 7:00 PM ET'

AND title is shown of the game event within the NTE card

Example: 'Nationals @ Orioles'

AND venueName is displayed within the NTE card

Example: 'Oriole Park'

AND description is displayed within the NTE card (if description provided in service call)

Example: '<Game Description>'

AND the background color of the NTE card is the primary color of the Home Team 

Example: Orange color for Orioles

AND the background image of the NTE card is shown matching what is passed in the service call 

Example: field/stadium image of the home team

AND the home team logo is shown within the NTE card (if logoPngURL/logoSvgURL for specific OS provided in service call)

Example: 'Orioles team logo'

AND 'Open Tickets' button is shown attached to NTE card
AND the color of 'Open Tickets' text is the primary color of the Home Team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Open Tickets' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to the deeplink provided in the service call, typically the scanview of the tickets 

Example deeplink: ballpark://scanview?eventID=12345&teamID=109 (where the eventID and teamID match the appropriate event)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user analyzes the tickets shown in the scanview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user can access tickets 
AND user has capability to forward or scan the tickets
AND team name, logo and color are correct

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the scanview of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to Home page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps the NTE card (above 'Open Tickets' button)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to the deeplink provided in the service call, typically the listview of the tickets
AND team name, logo and color are correct

Example deeplink: ballpark://listview?eventID=12345&teamID=109 (where the eventID and teamID match the appropriate event)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps back nav on listview of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to the Home page

title: Context Card: SetFavoriteTeam - Account with No Favorite Team
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.2.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
custom_steps:
WHEN user does not have favorite team(s) set
AND user is on the home tab
custom_expected:
THEN user is shown setFavoriteTeam context card
* Subject > Who do you root for? 
* Body > Select your favorite team to receive team-related information and content. 
* Image > https://zpl.io/bL6YYD6 (This image should be updated in FIGMA or desired location for source of truth) 
* CTA button 1 text > Select Your Team
* CTA button 1 action > deep link to Fav team selection - ballpark://favorite-teams

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user has not set favorite team(s)
AND user navigates to Home tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown 'Who do you root for?' context card

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Select Your Team' button within context card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is directed to My Teams page
deeplink: ballpark://favorite-teams

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user selects team(s) within My Teams page
AND user saves the selections to their account
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned back to Home page
AND setFavoriteTeam prompt is no longer shown

title: Context Card: TeamSchedulePrompt - Account with Favorite Team(s)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.2.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND has favorite team(s) set
custom_steps:
WHEN user is on the home tab

*current CardCreator rule is configured to only show context card for accts w/OUT ticketed event
custom_expected:
THEN user is shown teamSchedulePrompt context card
* Subject > Take me out to the ballgame!
* Body > Life’s better with baseball. Check out the <1st fav team nickname> schedule to browse tickets.
* Club cap logo of 1st favorite team (sourced from raster AND svg light active from teams firestore)
* CTA button 1 text > Shop Tickets 
* CTA button 1 action > Buy tix tab deeplink with teamID of 1st ranked favorite team - ballpark://buytickets?teamID=[favorite teamID]

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user has favorite team(s) set
AND user is on the home tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown teamSchedulePrompt context card
THEN the card's Subject is displayed as "Take me out to the ballgame!"
THEN the card's Body is displayed as "Life’s better with baseball. Check out the <1st fav team nickname> schedule to browse tickets."
THEN the card's Club cap logo of 1st favorite team is displayed (sourced from raster AND svg light active from teams firestore)
THEN the card's button text is displayed as "Shop Tickets"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps "Shop Tickets" button within context card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is directed to Tickets > Buy Tickets tab
AND the 1st ranked favorite team schedule is defaulted
deeplink: ballpark://buytickets?teamID=[favorite teamID]

title: Upcoming Section Shown - Eligibility Met
custom_preconds:
Requirements for Section/Cards shown (as of June 2021)
* location enabled (passed from BP to Home Service)
* available T-link for upcoming games (within 30 days)
* stadium location is within 60 miles of device location


GIVEN Ballpark app is installed (10.3.0 or greater)
AND user in logged into BP
custom_steps: WHEN all the eligibility requirements are met
custom_expected:
THEN Home Tab will display 'Upcoming Games' section with relevant matchup cards, providing a personalized experience

Display:
* In section “Upcoming”
* Reason for recommending string e.g. “Near You”
* Away logo overlaid on away primary, home logo over home primary
* Matchup string (e.g. Away team name vs Home team name)
* Date and time string (Mon, Apr 26 • 7:00 PM ET)
* Venue name string
* Event description string

mock: https://app.zeplin.io/project/602160fce3c37f64b50c8127/screen/60ac0eae82aeac2798344b41

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user's device location is enabled (and passing data from BP to Home Service)
AND an available T-link for upcoming games (within 30 days)
AND stadium location is within 60 miles of device location
AND the user is on the Home tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see an upcoming game matchup with a call to action to buy tickets

Display:
* In section “Upcoming Games”
* Reason for recommending string e.g. “Near You”
* Away logo overlaid on away primary, home logo over home primary
* Matchup string (e.g. Away team name vs Home team name)
* Date and time string (Mon, Apr 26 • 7:00 PM ET)
* Venue name string
* Event description string

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user tap's on the call to action to buy tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be taken to a purchase webview for the upsell game

title: Inbox Message Details
custom_preconds:
GIVEN User has Ballpark app installed 
AND user is logged in
AND Inbox feature is enabled
AND user has at least one message in the list of messages from a team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN User clicks on Inbox Icon in Home Tab Toolbar and has messages
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN list of messages will be presented

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN list of messages is presented
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the entry in the list will have:
*team logo
*team name (sender)
*subject
*body preview
*date received

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on message in the list
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN a screen with details of the message is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the screen of message details is presented which has an icon url
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN screen will be presented and message icon will be the value specified (i.e. "https://storage.mobile.mlbinfra.com/bplogos/2020/115@3x.png")

title: NextTicketedEvent (NTEv2) - Verified Primary Account for Game Event *[requires Tickets] [iOS ONLY]
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (13.1.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the Primary email for the account is verified
AND a game event is returned from box office ticketing service upcoming API
AND NTEv2 Home Card is configured (via Card Creator) for the specific venue of the NextTicketed Event


NOTES: 
*IOS EventHub uses NTEv2 Home card
*TDC and TM events should be tested (TM not supported initially)
custom_steps:
WHEN the primary email for the account is verified
AND user on the home tab
custom_expected:
THEN user will see Next Ticketed Card
AND be able to view event information 
AND be able to access tickets for forwarding or scanning

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a game event is returned for future date
AND user navigates to Home tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user will be shown Next Ticketed Event Card (v2)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user examines the Next Ticketed Event Card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN startTime/startTIimeLocalText is displayed as day of the week, date, and local time of event is shown within the Next Ticketed Event(NTE) card

Example: 'Tue, Apr 20 - 7:00 PM ET'

AND title is shown of the game event within the NTE card

Example: 'Nationals @ Orioles'

AND venueName is displayed within the NTE card

Example: 'Oriole Park'

AND description is displayed within the NTE card (if description provided in service call)

Example: '<Game Description>'

AND the background color of the NTE card is the primary color of the Home Team 

Example: Orange color for Orioles

AND the background image of the NTE card is shown matching what is passed in the service call 

Example: field/stadium image of the home team

AND the home team logo is shown within the NTE card (if logoPngURL/logoSvgURL for specific OS provided in service call)

Example: 'Orioles team logo'

AND 'Open Tickets' button is shown attached to NTE card
AND the color of 'Open Tickets' text is the primary color of the Home Team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Open Tickets' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to the deeplink provided in the service call, typically the scanview of the tickets 

Example deeplink: ballpark://scanview?eventID=12345&teamID=109 (where the eventID and teamID match the appropriate event)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user analyzes the tickets shown in the scanview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user can access tickets 
AND user has capability to scan the tickets (barcode shown, if available)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the scanview of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to Home page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps the NTE card (above 'Open Tickets' button)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to the EventHub page for that specific venue
AND user is shown a header info* particular to the event
AND user is shown a venue image directly below the event header info
AND user the venue image is directly above My Tickets and Stadium Info sections

*example of Header info:
**Tigers at Guardians (team logos on the right)
**Tue, May 7 * 610 PM EDT
**Progressive Field

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps back nav on EventHub of the venue
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to the Home page

title: Profile Card - Team Color
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.3.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user in on My Profile page

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user has a favorite team associated within MLB Account
AND user is on My Profile page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the background of the profile card is the favorite team's primary color

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user does NOT have a favorite team associated within MLB Account
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the background of the profile card is Ballpark grey(#f8f8f8)

WHEN user has a favorite team associated within MLB Account
AND user updates their first favorite team to another team (via My Teams)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the background of the profile card is updated to user's new favorite team's primary color

title: My Teams

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.1.0 or greater)

AND user in on My Profile page

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown 'My Teams' as a menu option

title: My History - Teams
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.1 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app	
AND user has prev check-ins

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user with prev check-ins is on the My History Page
AND taps on the number above 'Teams'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the Teams page with 'Teams' as header and back navigation arrow to the left.
AND entries(teams) are shown in the list-view with the team logo, team name, record and percentage shown for each
THEN dropdown selection shown for Team Records with 'Overall Team Records' shown as default

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on 'Overall Team Records' expander
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a bottom sheet modal appears with the three options:
* Overall Team Records (with a check to the right, indicating current selection)
* Home Team Records
* Away Team Records

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on 'Overall Team Records' within the bottom sheet
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bottom sheet modal is dismissed and the Team page is shown without any updates, since previous selection was 'Overall Team Records'

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps on 'Overall Team Records' expander
AND user taps on 'Home Team Records' within the bottom sheet

THEN 'Home Team Records' is shown as selected option
AND entries(teams) are shown in the list-view with the team logo, team name, record and percentage shown for each

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on 'Home Team Records' expander
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a bottom sheet modal appears with the three options:
* Overall Team Records
* Home Team Records (with a check to the right, indicating current selection)
* Away Team Records

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on 'Away Team Records' within the bottom sheet
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bottom sheet modal is dismissed and the Team page is shown without any changes to 'Teams Seen' and 'Home Team Record'

THEN 'Away Team Records' is shown as selected option
AND entries(teams) are shown in the list-view with the team logo, team name, record and percentage shown for each

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on 'Away Team Records' expander
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN a bottom sheet modal appears with the three options:
* Overall Team Records
* Home Team Records
* Away Team Records (with a check to the right, indicating current selection)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on 'X' within the bottom sheet
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the bottom sheet modal is dismissed and the Team page is shown without any changes to 'Teams Seen', 'Home Team Record', NOR team list-view

title: My History - Event Card
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.1 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user has prev check-ins
custom_expected: THEN Checkin images are seen related to Team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is in MY History Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN MY History Tab displays all the check Ins

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user is in My History tab, he wants to see all the images related to the teams with Date and Venue  and Teams Logo in card list items
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN User sees all the images for related team with date,Venue and the Teams Logo in card list items

title: Historic check-in
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.1 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user is on the My History Page
AND taps on '+' shown on top right corner
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the Add a Game page to allow addition of Past Games attended

THEN 'Add Past Games' label is shown
AND '* Required' label is shown
AND 'Year*' dropdown is shown and highlighted for input
AND 'Home Team *' dropdown is shown
AND 'Away Team' dropdown is shown
AND 'Month' dropdown is shown
AND further down on the page the following text is shown: "You will not be eligible to receive any offers or promotions related to past games. Check into live games to receive available offers and promotions."
AND 'Find Your Game' button in blue color is shown at the button of the page, but disabled until the required fields have inputs

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps on 'Year*' dropdown and picks the any previous year
AND user taps on 'Home Team*' dropdown
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the team names are shown 
AND I can validate all team names are correctly shown in alphabetical order from location

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user taps on desired Home Team
AND taps on 'Find Your Game' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown the Add a Game page
AND '< Back to Search' underneath the header
AND a label underneath with the month and year previously selected
AND a list-view with all games meeting the criteria
AND each entry has day of the week and date on the left, with the team names(i.e Marlins @ Braves) with team logos directly to left of the team name
And a '+' on the right for any games user has not previously checked-in OR a badge for any games user has previously checked-in

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on '+' on the game desired to be checked into
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown the Add a Game page
AND '< Back to Results' underneath the header
AND the expected match up with team logos(visiting logo on left and home logo on the right) , team names(i.e Marlins @ Braves), date and ballpark
AND 'What happened at the ballpark?' text as input field
AND 'Where did you sit?' text followed by 'Section', 'Row', 'Seat' text as input fields
AND a 'Save' button

custom_steps_separated.content:
When user fills out details in 'What happened at the ballpark?' input field
AND user fills out 'Section', 'Row', 'Seat' input fields
AND taps 'Save' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown the Add a Game page
AND 'You have successfully added this game!' is shown
AND 'Add Another Game' button with background blue color and white text is shown
AND 'Or' is shown followed by 'Go Back to My History' button with background white color and blue text is shown

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on 'Go Back to My History' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is taken back to My History page with the additional game that was just added
* game with details and seat filled out
* game with details filled out only
* game with seat filled out only
* game without details NOR seat filled out

(this can be verified by seeing the inputted details underneath the scores for games that had filled out details, and tapping into VIEW DETAILS link to verify inputted seat info)

title: Wallet Tab - Event Card

GIVEN new logos and colors are provided by product for a specific team

AND user has logged in
AND user has tapped Tickets tab
AND user has tickets available within their account for the particular team


bparkdev@gmail.com can be used to alternatively using own mlb account by frowarding ticket from bparkdev

custom_expected: THEN the team name, team logos, and colors are shown correctly for ALL applicable components

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to the Wallet Tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Event Cards will be displayed in the Wallet section

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user views the wallet card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Wallet card background will be the image as specified in the video poster URL supplied in ticket summary.  
* If video poster URL is null or an invalid URL, the card background will be the home team's default color.

AND the event information will contain The event date / time in the format (Ex. Sat, Jun 22 . 1:07 PM ET)
AND beneath the date time will be the Matchup Info displayed as Away Team @ Home Team
AND below the Matchup will be the Event's Venue
AND The home team's logo will be displayed to the right of the event matchup

title: Load Live Activity via Cached Ticket Data
custom_preconds:
[BP-10171](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10171 )


GIVEN User has successfully authenticated into Ballpark (BPapp: 12.2.0 or greater, iOS: 16.2 or greater)
AND the user has tickets already added to the BP account configured for Live Activities (TM and TDC events)

**NonGame Events (Concerts, Tours, Test Events, Etc) are NOT currently supported for Live Activities feature**
custom_expected: THEN section, row and seat is displayed in the pre-game state for both TDC & TM clubs

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user logs into BP app with a TDC event as next upcoming event
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown Home page with a Next Ticketed Event card (for TDC club)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user closes/backgrounds BP app
AND the user navigates to lock screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user's lock screen displays a Live Activity for the event showing:
*Ballpark logo (top left w/in widget)
*Team matchup logos (top right w/in widget)
*Seat information - Sec/Row/Seat (bottom left w/in widget)
*Game start time (bottom right w/in widget)
**time shown in time zone of device

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the Live Activity shown on the lock screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to BP app, opened to the Scanview of the event listed in the Live Activity
AND the Seat information (Sec/Row/Seat) matches what is shown in the Live Activity
AND the game start time matches what is shown in the Live Activity (time shown in local timezone of the event)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user logs into BP app with a TM event as next upcoming event
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown Home page with a Next Ticketed Event card (for TM club)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user closes/backgrounds BP app
AND the user navigates to lock screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user's lock screen displays a Live Activity for the event showing:
*Ballpark logo (top left w/in widget)
*Team matchup logos (top right w/in widget)
*Seat information - Sec/Row/Seat (bottom left w/in widget)
*Game start time (bottom right w/in widget)
**time shown in time zone of device

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the Live Activity shown on the lock screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to BP app, opened to the TMSDK of the event listed in the Live Activity (user may need to sign into TMSDK, if not prev logged in)
AND the Seat information (Sec/Row/Seat) matches what is shown in the Live Activity
AND the game start time matches what is shown in the Live Activity (time shown in local timezone of the event)

title: Dynamic Island  - Compact View & Full Platter View *(iPhone14 devices ONLY)
custom_preconds:
[BP-10158](https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/BP-10158 )

GIVEN the user has an iPhone 14 or 14 pro (Currently only supported for iPhone14 devices)
AND the user has successfully authenticated into Ballpark (BPapp: 12.2.0 or greater, iOS: 16.2 or greater)
AND the user has tickets already added to the BP account configured for Live Activities (TM and TDC events)
custom_expected:
THEN section, row and seat is displayed in the pre-game state for both TDC & TM clubs in the Dynamic Island feature (for iPhone14 devices)
AND section, row and seat is displayed in the pre-game state for both TDC & TM clubs in the Lock screen

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user logs into BP app with a TDC event as next upcoming event
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown Home page with a Next Ticketed Event card (for TDC club)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user closes/backgrounds BP app
AND the user navigates to Home screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is displayed a dynamic island when on the Home Screen (or other applications) 
AND the dynamic island feature has:
*a Ballpark logo shown on the left side
*Section number shown on the right side
**if 7 or less characters, “Sec xyz” is displayed
**if greater or equal to 8 characters, ticket icon is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user expands the dynamic island activity to see more detail

(Touch and hold the activity or swipe from the center to the right or left side)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Platter Full layout is displayed for the Dynamic Island activity
AND the dynamic island Full feature has:
*a Ballpark logo shown on the top left side
*Section number, Row, and Seat info are shown on the left side
*Matchup logos of the teams shown on the top right side
*Game start time shown on the right side

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the Live Activity shown on the dynamic island (compact layout)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to BP app, opened to the Scanview of the event listed in the Live Activity
AND the Seat information (Sec/Row/Seat) matches what is shown in the Live Activity
AND the game start time matches what is shown in the Live Activity (time shown in local timezone of the event)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the Live Activity shown on the dynamic island (full platter)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to BP app, opened to the Scanview of the event listed in the Live Activity
AND the Seat information (Sec/Row/Seat) matches what is shown in the Live Activity
AND the game start time matches what is shown in the Live Activity (time shown in local timezone of the event)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user logs into BP app with a TM event as next upcoming event
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user is shown Home page with a Next Ticketed Event card (for TM club)

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user closes/backgrounds BP app
AND the user navigates to Home screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is displayed a dynamic island when on the Home Screen (or other applications) 
AND the dynamic island feature has:
*a Ballpark logo shown on the left side
*Section number shown on the right side
**if 7 or less characters, “Sec xyz” is displayed
**if greater or equal to 8 characters, ticket icon is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user expands the dynamic island activity to see more detail

(Touch and hold the activity or swipe from the center to the right or left side)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Platter Full layout is displayed for the Dynamic Island activity
AND the dynamic island Full feature has:
*a Ballpark logo shown on the top left side
*Section number, Row, and Seat info are shown on the left side
*Matchup logos of the teams shown on the top right side
*Game start time shown on the right side

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the Live Activity shown on the dynamic island (compact layout)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to BP app, opened to the TMSDK of the event listed in the Live Activity (user may need to sign into TMSDK, if not prev logged in)
AND the Seat information (Sec/Row/Seat) matches what is shown in the Live Activity
AND the game start time matches what is shown in the Live Activity (time shown in local timezone of the event)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the Live Activity shown on the dynamic island (full platter)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to BP app, opened to the TMSDK of the event listed in the Live Activity (user may need to sign into TMSDK, if not prev logged in)
AND the Seat information (Sec/Row/Seat) matches what is shown in the Live Activity
AND the game start time matches what is shown in the Live Activity (time shown in local timezone of the event)

title: Onboarding
custom_preconds:
GIVEN new logos and colors are provided by product for a specific team
AND user has installed Ballpark App
custom_steps: WHEN a new user completes onboarding
custom_expected:
THEN the teampicker should be presented with the correct Team/Logo/Colors 
AND shown correctly upon team selection and completion of onboarding

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user starts onboarding process
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN Team Picker Screen is presented

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the Team Picker Screen is presented
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see a header with bolded text that reads " Select Your Favorite Team"
AND below there will be a 3x10 grid of cells containing all 30 MLB teams
AND all cells will have a white background
AND each cell will contain the correct MLB team logo
AND each cell will contain the city and team name
AND the footer will contain a blue color to "Next" button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on a team cell
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the team will be highlighted in the team's primary color
AND the team logo will change to the light version
AND a number will be displayed in the top right corner to display the priority of the team.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user has at least one team has been selected
AND the user taps on a previously selected team cell
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the cell's background will be returned to white
AND the team's logo will revert back to the Dark version
AND the priority indication number will no longer be displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on multiple team cells
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the priority indicator will display order as followed: first selected team is "1", the most favorite team; second selected is "2", second most favorite etc.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps 'Next' button
AND the user completes the onboarding process (creating a new acct)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user is shown the HomePage with Home highlighter on the NavBar
AND the NavBar has the favorited team's logo shown greyed out with correct name and logo

AND the user is shown a Team Schedule context card ('Take me out to the ballgame!') with:
*the correct team name shown in the description 
*the correct logo and color shown as an icon matching the hex value and team logo provided by product/design
